question: When might an empty alt attribute be the correct value?

when you don't think it would be interesting to someone who cannot see it
when the image has come from a CMS
when the image is purely decorative
answer: when the image is purely decorative

It is obsolete and is not recommended for use in marking web content

It employs incorrect syntax that will cause the browser to crash
answer: It is obsolete and is not recommended for use in marking web content

question: How does the rem unit represent a font size?
options: Font sizes are expressed relative to the font size of the containing div element
Font sizes are expressed relative to the font size of the parent elements
Font sizes are relative to the base font size of the operating system.
Font sizes are relative to the root em unit used in the HTML element.
answer: Font sizes are relative to the root em unit used in the HTML element.

Which description correctly describes the initial values of flex items if you have applied `display: flex` to their parent?
options: Items display in a row, lined up at the start, and do not stretch to fill the container
Items display in a column, lined up at the start, and do not stretch to fill the container
Items stay in a column until you add some flex properties.
Items displayed in a row, lined up at the start and stretched to fill the container
answer: Items display in a row, lined up at the start, and do not stretch to fill the container

question: Which line of code, if applied to all flex items in a flex container, would cause each flex item to take up an equal share of the total width of the container? For example, if there are four items, they would get 25% of each.
A video on your webpage does not display and the console shows an error about mixed content. What is happening?
options: The webpage is using a DOCTYPE, which renders it incapable of displayed video in addition to other web content.
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
The video is from a source that cannot be displayed in your location for legal reasons.
The page is loaded via HTTPS, but the video is being served insecurely as HTTP and the browser is blocking it.
answer: The page is loaded via HTTPS, but the video is being served insecurely as HTTP and the browser is blocking it.

A webpage has `rel="preconnect"` added to a link resource. What will this do?
options: It will tell the browser that this link is a site belonging to the current domain.
It will do nothing because this is a deprecated attribute that browsers do not support.
It will tell the browser that a connection will be made to another origin and to start getting ready as soon as possible.
It will tell the browser that a resource is needed, and that it should start getting fetched as soon as possible.
answer: It will tell the browser that a connection will be made to another origin and to start getting ready as soon as possible.

options: all \<a> tags whose href attribute begins with "org"
all \<a> tags whose href attribute equals "org"
all \<a> tags whose href attribute ends with "org"
all \<a> tags whose href attribute contains "org"
answer: all \<a> tags whose href attribute ends with "org"

question: Which choice is not a result of invoking strict mode in JavaScript?
options: It eliminates some JavaScript silent errors by changing them to throw errors.
It prohibits some syntax likely to be defined in future versions of ECMAScript.
It forces the writing of valid HTML and CSS.
It fixes mistakes that make it difficult for JavaScript engines to perform optimizations.
answer: It forces the writing of valid HTML and CSS.

options: Apply `float: left` to the second paragraph.
Apply `clear: right` to the floated item.
Apply `clear: left` to the second paragraph.
Apply `clear: left` to the floated item.
answer: Apply `clear: left` to the second paragraph.

options: The CSS is being loaded asynchronously in order to prevent render blocking.
This will stop the CSS from being loaded for old browsers that do not support the techniques in use.
This is part of a stylesheet-switching script to load different themes for the site.

answer: The CSS is being loaded asynchronously in order to prevent render blocking.

question: The flex property is often applied to flex items with a value of 1. Using flex: 1 is a shorthand - what does it unpack to?
What is the meaning of "tree shaking" in relation to JavaScript performance?
options: only using code that is supported by the newest browsers, and serving the site without JavaScript to old browsers
removing unused code from the JavaScript files
splitting code into various bundles so that decisions can be made on loading priority
allowing the browser to ignore code it believes will perform badly
answer: removing unused code from the JavaScript files

question: What is WebP?
options: a method of auditing performance that gives your site a score, which is then used for Google ranking
a next-generation image format offering a smaller file size than equivalent PNG or JPEG images
a new font format that allows a single font to display at different styles and weights
a next-generation PDF format that offers a smaller file size and better accessibility than standard PDF documents
answer: a next-generation image format offering a smaller file size than equivalent PNG or JPEG images

question: Your website uses CSS Grid Layout extensively, and a visitor who navigates using the keyboard tells you that they seem to jump erratically all over the screen when navigating. What is the most likely problem?
options: The visitor's browser does not have full support for CSS Grid Layout.
Items have been positioned in such a way that they are in a different order to the source.
The browser has a keyboard navigation bug.
You need to add the tabindex attribute to elements.?
answer: Items have been positioned in such a way that they are in a different order to the source.

question: What is the definition of the phrase "Time to Interactive"?
options: when the browser displays the first bit of content from the DOM
when the user can consistently interact with all of the page elements
when HTML has loaded, but not necessarily JavaScript, CSS, or images
when the user can see the webpage on the screen
answer: when the user can consistently interact with all of the page elements

question: What is yarn?
options: a JavaScript framework that is leaner than React

question: What is the name of the event that occurs when the mouse pointer hovers over an element?
What is meant by the term "polyfill" when used in web development?
options: It is a piece of code that provides modern functionality in browsers that do not support it.
It is a piece of code that hides broken content from old browsers.
It is a term for languages such as Saas that compile to CSS.
It is a script that runs to add vendor prefixes to modern CSS.
answer: It is a piece of code that provides modern functionality in browsers that do not support it.

question: Which choice is _not_ a JavaScript framework?
What does setting `aria-live=polite` on a live region achieve?
options: The screen reader will not notify the user of changes to live regions.
The screen reader will wait until there is a pause to announce changes.
The screen reader will announce all changes immediately.
The screen reader will use a polite voice when announcing changes.
answer: The screen reader will wait until there is a pause to announce changes.

options: converts ECMAScript 2015+ code into backward compatible version of JS to support older browsers
used to bundle individual JS files for use in your website

it is a SSR library that can enhance SEO and accessibility of your site

options: the tint of the color matching 38 degrade on the color wheel
the opacity of the color indicating 38% of fully opacity
the brightness of the color matching a brightness of 38%
the intensity of the color matching an intensity of 38%
answer: the tint of the color matching 38 degrade on the color wheel

question: What is a skiplink?
options: a method of allowing a screen-reader user to skip between headings
a link placed early in the <body> to allow the user to skip to the main content
a link to allow users to skip video that automatically plays on a website
answer: a link placed early in the <body> to allow the user to skip to the main content

question: On a page with many images, what would be the effect of adding loading="lazy" to the tag?
options: It will speed up the loading of the image when used with a JavaScript library
In supporting browsers, images will be highly compressed, therefore loading more quickly
In supporting browsers, images will load only when they are in or near the visible viewport
In supporting browsers, images will not load unless the user explicitly requests image loading
answer: In supporting browsers, images will load only when they are in or near the visible viewport

question: What is GraphQL?
options: a React library for storing data
a Vue.js library for storing and manipulating data
a query language for fetching data from APIs
a new database format designed to replace MySQL
answer: a query language for fetching data from APIs

question: Which choice will place a multiline text input field on the page?
Which browser is not based on Chromium?
In supporting browsers, what would be the effect of using font-display: swap, as in the example?
options: The browser will show no content until the web font loads.
The browser will ignore the web font.
The browser will ignore the web font in a situation where the user has indicated they are saving data.
The browser will load a system font while waiting for the web font to load.
answer: The browser will load a system font while waiting for the web font to load.

question: What does the term "code splitting" mean with regard to JavasScript performance?
options: allowing the browser to ignore code that it believes will perform badly
splitting code into various bundles so that decisions can be made on loading priority
removing unused code from JavaScript files
only using code that is supported by the newest browsers, and serving the site without JavaScript to old browsers
answer: splitting code into various bundles so that decisions can be made on loading priority

options: have the same value as the id attribute
have the same value of the name attribute
belong to the same field set
have the same value as the class attribute
answer: have the same value of the name attribute

question: Which statement about HTML syntax is _false_?
options: The value of a class attribute should be unique in an HTML document.
The `` element does not have a closing `` tag.
The `<h1>` element is the most important heading on the page.
The value of an id attribute should be unique in an HTML document.
answer: The value of a class attribute should be unique in an HTML document.
